meanings.definition: A decorative technique of inserting pieces of contrasting material into a surface to form patterns or pictures.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a beautiful inlay on the wooden table, using different colored wood pieces.
meanings.sent2: The intricate inlay on the jewelry box added a touch of elegance to the design.
meanings.sent3: The inlay on the guitar was so detailed that it looked like a tiny mosaic.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes widened in amazement as she saw the inlay on the ancient vase, marveling at the craftsmanship.
meanings.sent5: The inlay on the floor shimmered in the sunlight, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To set pieces of material into a surface in a decorative pattern.
meanings.sent1: She carefully inlayed the gemstones into the silver bracelet, creating a stunning piece of jewelry.
meanings.sent2: The artisan used a delicate hammer to inlay the tiles onto the tabletop, ensuring a smooth finish.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he could inlay the entire room with chocolate if he had enough of it.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood inlayed themselves into her mind like pieces of a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The music seemed to inlay itself into the fabric of the night, creating a magical atmosphere.
